ca.utoronto.msrg.padres.common.comm.rmi
Class RMIServer 

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
RMIServerInterface, Remote 
public class RMIServer
				
extends CommServer
				
implements RMIServerInterface

Author:
Bala Maniymaran Created: 2010-08-12 The communication server that implements the RMI protocol. Most of the server functionalities are defined in the RMIServerInterface

Constructor Detail

RMIServer

public RMIServer(RMIAddress serverAddress,
                 CommSystem commSystem)
          throws CommunicationException
Constructor for creating a RMI server. It checks for the RMI registry given in the URI. If the registry is supposed to be in the localhost, but not found, it instantiate an RMI registry locally.

Parameters:
serverAddress - The URI of the RMI server.
commSystem - The communication system that creates this server
Throws:
CommunicationException - This is thrown in the cases of
  • there is error in parsing the serverURI
  • the broker ID did not match the entity ID given in the serverURI
  • the registry could not be found or could not be instantiated locally
  • the entity could not be registered

registerMessageListener

public void registerMessageListener(MessageDestination clientDest,
                                    RMIMessageListenerInterfce msgListener)
                             throws RemoteException
Description copied from interface: RMIServerInterface
This method is called by a remote entity to register a RMI message listener at a RMI server. The server will use this message listener to convey a message back to the remote entity. In PADRES, it is used by a client in the client->broker communication. When a message listener is registered, the comm. system should inform the connection listener

Specified by:
registerMessageListener in interface RMIServerInterface
Parameters:
clientDest - The destination of the remote entity to which the message listener belongs
msgListener - The RMI message listener to receive message from the server implementing this interface
Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
ConnectionListenerInterface}
